subject: Fashion
title: Cotton's Global Dominance
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cotton's Global Dominance usable.

hook.text: Cotton makes up 27% of all textiles. Nothing else comes close.

buildup.text: It grows in warm climates across India, China, the US, and Brazil.

discovery.text: Cotton breathes well, absorbs moisture, and feels soft against skin.

twist.text: But it drinks waterâ€”one T-shirt needs 2,700 liters to produce.

climax.text: Organic cotton uses less water and no pesticides, but costs more.

punchline.text: Cotton is comfort. The cost is hidden in water.

quiz.question: How much water does producing one cotton T-shirt require?
